solution_line_template: First find the length of the waist: {hem_length} cm / {waist_divisor} = <<{hem_length}/{waist_divisor}={waist_length}>>{waist_length} cm
Then find the total amount of lace she uses on the cuffs: {num_cuffs} cuffs * {cuff_length} cm/cuff = <<{num_cuffs}*{cuff_length}={total_cuff_lace}>>{total_cuff_lace} cm
Then find the total amount of lace she uses on the ruffles: {num_ruffles} ruffles * {ruffle_length} cm/ruffle = <<{num_ruffles}*{ruffle_length}={total_ruffle_lace}>>{total_ruffle_lace} cm

Then add each amount of lace she uses to find the total: {total_cuff_lace} cm + {waist_length} cm + {total_ruffle_lace} cm + {hem_length} cm = <<{total_cuff_lace}+{waist_length}+{total_ruffle_lace}+{hem_length}={total_lace_cm}>>{total_lace_cm} cm
Then convert that length to meters to by dividing by {cm_per_meter}: {total_lace_cm} cm / {cm_per_meter} cm/m = <<{total_lace_cm}/{cm_per_meter}={total_lace_m}>>{total_lace_m} m
Finally, multiply the total meters of lace needed by the cost per meter to find the total cost: {total_lace_m} m * ${cost_per_meter}/m = $<<{total_lace_m}*{cost_per_meter}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
